      20                 :            : namespace MDAL

      22                 :            :   /**
      23                 :            :    * This class is used to read the selafin file format.
      24                 :            :    * The file is opened with initialize() and stay opened until this object is destroyed
      25                 :            :    *
      26                 :            :    * \note SelafinFile object is shared between different datasets, with the mesh and its iterators.
      27                 :            :    *       As SelafinFile is not thread safe, it has to be shared in the same thread.
      28                 :            :    *
      29                 :            :    * This class can be used to create a mesh with all the dataset contained in a file with the static method createMessh()
      30                 :            :    * It is also p√¥ssible to add all the dataset of a file in a separate existing mesh with the static method populateDataset()
      31                 :            :    *
      32                 :            :    * All the method to access with lazy loading to the mesh data or datasets are encapsulted and only accessible by the friend classes :
      33                 :            :    *    MeshSelafin
      34                 :            :    *    MeshSelafinVertexIterator
      35                 :            :    *    MeshSelafinFaceIterator
      36                 :            :    *    DatasetSelafin
      37                 :            :    *
      38                 :            :    * This ecapsulation protects these lazy loading access methods because they can't be used before the instance of SelafinFile has been initialized and parsed.
      39                 :            :    *
      40                 :            :   */

     275                 :            : 
     276                 :            :   /**
     277                 :            :    * Serafin format (also called Selafin)
     278                 :            :    *
     279                 :            :    * Binary format for triangular mesh with datasets defined on vertices
     280                 :            :    * Source of this doc come from :
     281                 :            :    * http://www.opentelemac.org/downloads/MANUALS/TELEMAC-2D/telemac-2d_user_manual_en_v7p0.pdf Appendix 3
     282                 :            :    * https://www.gdal.org/drv_selafin.html
     283                 :            :    *
     284                 :            :    * The Selafin file records are listed below:
     285                 :            :    * - 1 record containing the title of the study (72 characters) and a 8 characters string indicating the type
     286                 :            :    *    of format (SERAFIN or SERAFIND)
     287                 :            :    * - record containing the two integers NBV(1)and NBV(2)(number of linear and quadratic variables, NBV(2)with the value of 0 for Telemac,
     288                 :            :    * cas quadratic values are not saved so far),
     289                 :            :    * - NBV(1)records containing the names and units of each variable (over 32 characters),
     290                 :            :    * - 1 record containing the integers table IPARAM(10 integers, of which only the 6are currently being used),
     291                 :            :    *        - if IPARAM (3)!=0: the value corresponds to the x-coordinate of the origin of the mesh,
     292                 :            :    *        - if IPARAM (4)!=0: the value corresponds to the y-coordinate of the origin of the mesh,
     293                 :            :    *        - if IPARAM (7): the value corresponds to the number of  planes on the vertical (3D computation),
     294                 :            :    *        - if IPARAM (8)!=0: the value corresponds to the number of boundary points (in parallel),
     295                 :            :    *        - if IPARAM (9)!=0: the value corresponds to the number of interface points (in parallel),
     296                 :            :    *        - if IPARAM(8 ) or IPARAM(9) !=0: the array IPOBO below is replaced by the array KNOLG(total initial number of points).
     297                 :            :    *            All the other numbers are local to the sub-domain, including IKLE.
     298                 :            :    *
     299                 :            :    * - if IPARAM(10)= 1: a record containing the computation starting date,
     300                 :            :    * - 1 record containing the integers NELEM,NPOIN,NDP,1(number of elements, number of points, number of points per element and the value 1),
     301                 :            :    * - 1 record containing table IKLE(integer array of dimension (NDP,NELEM) which is the connectivity table.
     302                 :            :    *    N.B.: in TELEMAC-2D, the dimensions of this array are (NELEM,NDP)),
     303                 :            :    * - 1 record containing table IPOBO(integer array of dimension NPOIN);
     304                 :            :    *    the value of one element is 0 for an internal point, and gives the numbering of boundary points for the others,
     305                 :            :    * - 1 record containing table X(real array of dimension NPOINcontaining the abscissae of the points),
     306                 :            :    * - 1 record containing table Y(real array of dimension NPOINcontaining the ordinates of the points),
     307                 :            :    *
     308                 :            :    * Next, for each time step, the following are found:
     309                 :            :    * - 1 record containing time T(real),
     310                 :            :    * - NBV(1)+NBV(2)records containing the results tables for each variable at time T.
     311                 :            :    */
     312                 :            :   class DriverSelafin: public Driver
     313                 :            :   {
     314                 :            :     public:
     315                 :            :       DriverSelafin();
     316                 :            :       ~DriverSelafin() override;
     317                 :            :       DriverSelafin *create() override;

     319                 :            :       bool canReadMesh( const std::string &uri ) override;
     320                 :            :       bool canReadDatasets( const std::string &uri ) override;
     321                 :            : 
     322                 :            :       std::unique_ptr< Mesh > load( const std::string &meshFile, const std::string &meshName = "" ) override;
     323                 :            :       void load( const std::string &datFile, Mesh *mesh ) override;
     324                 :            : 
     325                 :            :       bool persist( DatasetGroup *group ) override;
     326                 :            : 
     327                 :          0 :       int faceVerticesMaximumCount() const override {return 3;}
     328                 :            :       void save( const std::string &fileName,  const std::string &meshName, Mesh *mesh ) override;
     329                 :            : 
     330                 :            :       std::string writeDatasetOnFileSuffix() const override;
     331                 :            :       std::string saveMeshOnFileSuffix() const override;
     332                 :            : 
     333                 :            :     private:
     334                 :            :       bool saveDatasetGroupOnFile( DatasetGroup *datasetGroup );
     335                 :            :   };
